intro: Clematoclethra guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi clethra, is a species of flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
